elect.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to choose someone for an official position by voting
elect.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the country’s first democratically elected government
a new method for electing the leader of the party
In 1768, John Wilkes was elected as their Member of Parliament.
He was elected to a US state governorship.
elect.translation[0].definitions[0].note: Elect is often passive in this meaning
elect.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to choose someone for an official position by voting
elect.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: the country’s first democratically elected president
John Brown was elected to the board last year.
Steven J. Shapiro was elected vice president, corporate planning.
elect.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a person who has been elected to a particular job but has not yet started doing it
elect.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: the Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce’s chairman elect
